thread.title: Hospital launches 'aggressive' probe into how ESPN got NFL player's chart
thread.title_full: Hospital launches 'aggressive' probe into how ESPN got NFL player's chart

title: Hospital launches 'aggressive' probe into how ESPN got NFL player's chart
text:
RSS ABC 17 News / CNN Money , July 10, 2015 
A Florida hospital said Thursday that it has launched an "aggressive" investigation into the release of an NFL player's private medical records. The probe comes a day after ESPN reporter Adam Schefter tweeted a photo of a medical chart indicating that New York Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul had a finger amputated, the result of a fireworks accident on the Fourth of July. ESPN defended Schefter's reporting, noting that the 1996 law safeguarding the privacy of medical records -- the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act or "HIPAA" -- "does not apply to news organizations."
